Sound sequence things can be placed in a [[sector]] to override the default [[SNDSEQ|sound sequence]] associated with floor and ceiling movement in this sector. They are ''not'' to be confused with {{Class|SoundSequence}} actors.
There are eleven such things: *1400-1409 set the sector's sound sequence to ID 0-9. *1411 uses the first arg of the thing to define the sound sequence in a sector. 255 means to use the default.
In [[Universal Doom Map Format|UDMF]], you can use the {{c|soundsequence}} sector property instead of placing a sound sequence thing. Use the sound sequence name instead of its number. This also allows you to use sound sequences that do not have a number, as well as using a door sound sequence in a platform sector or vice-versa. [[Category:Special ZDoom things]]
